titles.title: To direct the Secretary of the Interior to grant to Deschutes and Crook Counties in the State of Oregon a right-of-way to West Butte Road.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Recreation and Public Lands.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Subcommittee on National Parks, Recreation and Public Lands Discharged.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 107-637.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 386.

action.text: Mr. Hansen moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4953.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

calendar.text: Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 611.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Recreation, and Public Lands
committee.name: House Resources

bill.summary: 9/24/2002--Passed House amended. Directs the Secretary of the Interior, acting through the Director of the Bureau of Land Management, to grant to Crook and Deschutes Counties, Oregon, a right-of-way to West Butte Road which shall: (1) extend from Reservoir Road in Crook County to U.S. Route 20 in Deschutes County; and (2) extend in width 100 feet on each side of the centerline of West Butte Road.Directs the Counties to address specified environmental concerns associated with any development of West Butte Road.Requires the counties, in exchange for the rights-of-way, to relinquish any right, title, or interest in any right-of-way claim held to George Millican Road.
